content:
For a personal research project I would like to store some environmental factors as pollen count, temperature outside, humidity outside as observations for a given location, in addition I would like to register symptoms from the patient.

Any suggestions on suitable ways of thinking this in FHIR structures?
have you looked at the gravity social determinents of health guide? this is structurally a very similar idea even if it's not the same data

Thanks for the link! Sorry, a bit noob in this field.
But this project seems to collect patient reported environmental factors thorugh questionnaires. For my project I would like this approach for the part with patient reporting the symptoms.

However I was thinking that for the environmental factors associated with an physical location, it might be better to store this data as observations directly from the sensors in a way?
sorry, I wasn't paying enough attention. The symptoms from the patient -that bit is similar. The environmental factors - sound like observations on a location
Thanks for your support, so a questionnaire for patient reported data, and observations associated with location for environmental data!
sure. you could look at the SDC implementation guide which has quite a bit to say about the relationship between questionnaires and observations
